data.title: Richmond Rod And Gun
data.meta_description: We have static rifle & pistol ranges, an action pistol range with 6 bays, and a Trap & Skeet range with 5 combination fields.
data.text:
Open Wednesdays, Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays from 9:00 AM to 4:00 PM for Members and accompanied guests.

The 25-yard line has 18 lanes for pistol and 22LR firearms and 2 shotgun lanes. There are six 7 yard lanes and 15 other variable lanes at 15 and 25 yards.

The 100-yard line is divided into 50-yard and 100-yard distances. There are 12 positions for centerfire rifles.

The 200-yard line is mainly a competition range, but is usually open 1-2 days a month for shooters who can maintain all shots within the 8-ring at 100-yards.

Rifle Range Fee: $8/hour for members. $15/hour for accompanied member guests.

Open Saturdays from 9:00 AM to 1:30 PM to pre-qualified competitors (closed for all USPSA matches, major matches and events). The last shooter checkin will be at 1:00 pm.

To shoot on the action range, you must complete the RRGC Safe Handgun Competitor Class or earned a classification rating in one of the recognized disciplines (USPSA, IDPA, SASS, or ICORE).

See the Richmond Hot Shots website for more information.

Action Range Saturday Practice Fee: $7 for members, credit card only at action range.

Open Wednesdays, Saturdays, and Sundays from 10 AM to 3 PM.

The skeet range has 4 skeet fields and 1 trap field.

Shooting skeet involves rotating through eight stations along an arch as targets are launched from the high house (on the shooter's left) and low house (right).

Trap shooting involves shooting targets from a central house. Shooters rotate through five stations after five shots.

​

Skeet/Trap Fee:

$7 per 25-target round for Members

$10 per 25-target round for accompanied Member guests

​

Since we shoot over the bay, you must purchase our shotgun ammunition as it is non-toxic. NO LEAD SHOT IS ALLOWED ON THE TRAP/SKEET FIELDS
